Steps to reproduce
------------------
After enabling OpenSSH server, adding the firewall rule for port 22, making the necessary changes to the sshd_config file including adding Subsystem line to sshd_config file:
```
Port 22
PubkeyAuthentication yes
PasswordAuthentication yes
Subsystem powershell c:\Program Files\PowerShell\6\pwsh.exe -sshs -nologon -noprofile 
```
Open a pwsh session in Linux:
```powershell
PowerShell 6.1.0
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/maxt> Enter-PSSession -HostName venus -UserName max_t               
The authenticity of host 'venus (192.168.164.149)' can't be established.
ECDSA key fingerprint is SHA256:DNx4Un5zxoZi+r88KAD542g9VwgfhiIuLuJ1FBY+XEA.
ECDSA key fingerprint is MD5:38:e1:de:6e:8d:ad:c8:c4:ee:62:60:c0:ff:7d:c2:ba.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
Warning: Permanently added 'venus,192.168.164.149' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts.
max_t@venus's password: 
Enter-PSSession : There is an error processing data from the background process. Error reported: The argument '-nologon' is not recognized as the name of a script file. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again..
At line:1 char:1
+ Enter-PSSession -HostName venus -UserName max_t
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (:) [Enter-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSRemotingDataStructureException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.EnterPSSessionCommand
 
PS /home/maxt>
```
This is not a issue in Linux as the following Subsystem lines works:
```
Subsystem	powershell pwsh -sshs -NoLogo -NoProfile
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
No error when using the -nologon parameter.

```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------
PSRemoting connection failed due to following message:
```none
 Error reported: The argument '-nologon' is not recognized as the name of a script file. 
```

Workaround
---------------
In Windows Systems ONLY
To remove the parameter -nologon from the Subsystem line:
```
Subsystem powershell c:\Program Files\PowerShell\6\pwsh.exe -sshs -noprofile 
```
After removing the -nologon parameter, now I can connect from non-Windows systems to Windows.
Happy Day!!
